summary: DNA shuffling accelerates directed evolution by generating diverse chimaeric genes, leading to significant improvements in enzyme activity compared to single gene evolution.
key_claims: DNA shuffling yields eightfold improvements from four separately evolved genes versus a 270-to 540-fold improvement from the four genes shuffled together per cycle.

Reiterative cycles of shuffling followed by screening or selection have been effective in evolving single gene products with enhanced activity, altered substrate specificity, and improved protein folding.
